intro: Lophion striatum, commonly known as the striped lophion, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color, often appearing in late summer or early autumn. Lophion striatum is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
